column4: - macOS application to easily install/backup/restore images onto an SD card.
- SD card burner app that is simple for end users, extensible for developers, and works on any platform.
- Bash script that automatically shrinks a pi image that will then resize to the max size of the SD card on boot.
- Shell script to set up Raspberry Pi as an OpenVPN server.
- Tool used to create the raspberrypi.org Raspbian images. This can be used to create your own custom images with specific packages installed, etc.
- Simple, Flexible, and Managable single line install of OpenVPN Server for your Raspberry Pi.
- Setup a Pi Zero to scan for devices on a WiFi network and use that to determine who is "home".
- Simple application/repo to bridge a Raspberry Pi's wlan0 interface to devices plugged into it over ethernet (eth0).
- Simple tool to generate wpa_supplicant.conf files with wifi settings
- Simple tool to launch QEMU on Raspbian with the required modifications on the system and kernel. Automatic network access. Handy to create images in your PC.
- A simple, responsive web interface to control wifi, hostapd and related services on the Raspberry Pi.
- HAT which includes vital health monitoring like ECG, respiration, pulse oximetry and optional blood pressure & body temperature sensing.
- Exploits locked/password protected computers over USB, drops persistent WebSocket-based backdoor, exposes internal router, and siphons cookies using Raspberry Pi Zero & Node.js.
- P4wnP1 is a highly customizable USB attack platform, based on a low cost Raspberry Pi Zero or Raspberry Pi Zero W (required for HID backdoor).
- Web UI for creating custom images with specific packages installed.
- Remotely load, debug and test bare-metal programs using GDB with this system-level GDB server.
- Script for creating custom images based on Raspbian, Devuan, Ubuntu and Alpine Linux.
- Wifi AP + Client management in 8MB
- Shell script to automate the task of converting Raspberry Pi into a tor based wifi hotspot.
- Processing Development Environment running on Raspberry Pi.
- 3D printed mini MIDI controller.
- Enclosure in a power strip, sniffing network data.
- Erlang cluster on a Raspberry Pi 2.
- Nixie Tube Clock powered by a Raspberry Pi.
- Cluster aimed to be under the size of full tower desktop.
- Big Data cluster running on the Raspberry Pi.
- Showcase for the always on, fault tolerant nature of Cassandra using a Raspberry Pi cluster board.
- Highly redundant and low power usage RADOS home storage solution.
- Voice controlled smart mirror with IoT integration.
- The original open source modular smart mirror platform.
- Timed charging station for students using Chromebooks at school.
- Flexible open source personal assistant.
- Led lighting solution dedicated for raspberry pi and your TV.
- Raspberry Pi based home alarm system.
- Fancy Clock built around a monitor and a Raspberry Pi.
- Garage door opener using the
- Raspberry Pi car computer.
- CPU-fan-tuner daemon, just enables your fan as necessary.
- Take over and allow full control over any Parrot AR Drone within wireless distance.
- Craft and deploy bulletproof embedded software in Elixir.
- Run a Wordpress site in containers with dynamic DNS.
- Black hole for internet ads.
- Node.js Slackbot (lunchbot), hosted on Resin.
- Node.js voice control for your Pi (and everything else) with customizable offline hotword detection.
- The Live Coding Music Synth for Everyone.
- Demonstration on using Alexa Voice Service with a Java client and Node.js server.
- Java I/O library the Raspberry Pi.
- Display mimicking the Daily Prophet from Harry Potter using a 7" Raspberry Pi display.
- Makeshift Amazon Dash orders using a Raspberry PI + EAN scanner.
- E-ink nametag display running on a Pi Zero.
- Interactive soundart installation using the Hifiberry DAC.
- simple smart desktop clock using a Raspberry Pi display.
- Home automation based on sound recognition from notes played on an ocarina.
- Sequencer/Drumpad, like Native Instruments' Maschine for the Pi.
- Transforming the transience of the spoken word into something concrete and physical through a microphone, waveform and thermal printer.
- Raspberry Pi Zero Rubber Ducky recognized as a USB HID by just about anything with a USB port, thus allowing you to run custom scripts as if it were a keyboard.
- Get your ARM device up and running Kubernetes in less than ten minutes.
- Smart Lamp for Better Sleep.
- Uses a tilt & pan laser to find a record in a record collection.
- Remotely deploying timelapse camera using Docker, Resin, and 3G internet.
- Robot bartender for making cocktails with Telegram-bot interface and speech synthesis on Golang.
- Open source ADS-B reciever which feeds weather, traffic, GPS, and AHRS data to electronic flight bag software via wifi.
- AIY Voice Kit from Google, to build a standalone voice recognition system using the Google Assistant, or add voice recognition and natural language processing to your Raspberry Pi-based projects.
- Object Motion Tracking uses python, openCV, USB Cam or picamera module to record speed data.
- Remote Headless multi feature PiCamera Operation from Rclone Remote Storage Service and More.
- A Raspberry Pi powered prototype of a hearing aid.
- CPU GPU temperature monitor with various functions such as LED GPIO, Graph output, email, alarm limit, notifications and logging.
- Python 3 library to connect various motors & servos to the Pi.
- A C++ bare metal environment for Raspberry Pi.
- Smart Doll House with Gesture Recognition, using Raspberry Pi 3 or Pi Zero and PSMove motion controller.
- Skateboard odometer and speedometer with RFID user system.
- Controller software for the Occu-pi, a totally awesome bathroom door sensor.
- Tool to monitor downstream load on DOCSIS cable networks.
- Honey beehive monitoring project.
- Payment module based on RFID.
- Beginner’s Guide to ️⚡Lightning️⚡ on a Raspberry Pi.
- Fastest and cheapest way to get your own Lightning Node running.s
